We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Executive

Job Location: Gamak World and Wellness Clinic, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	We are looking for a smart, courteous, and detail-oriented Customer Service Executive to join our team.
	This role is vital to ensuring smooth daily operations and delivering excellent client service.

	Welcome and attend to clients professionally

	Handle patient records, files, and confidential details

N100,000 monthly.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Risk Manager",
  "description": "Eat &#39;N&rsquo; Go Limited is a restaurant group on a mission to become the premier food operator in Africa. So far, our growing family consists of three international brands, Domino&#39;s Pizza, Cold Stone Creamery &amp; Pinkberry.
Eat &lsquo;N&rsquo; Go limited officially started operation in August 2012 with the premier store at 4, Saka Tinubu Victoria Island, Lagos. Today, Eat N&#39; Go has about 100 stores (outlet) across Nigeria and still growing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Risk Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Description


	To lead the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Unit and drive the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of a robust risk management framework across the organization.
	The Risk Manager will ensure that risks are proactively identified, assessed, monitored, and mitigated in alignment with the organization&rsquo;s strategic objectives and in accordance with the Three Lines Model of governance.


Responsibilities
Strategic Risk Leadership:


	&nbsp;Develop and implement the organization&rsquo;s enterprise risk management framework, policies, and procedures.
	&nbsp;Align risk management practices with corporate strategy and regulatory requirements.
	Promote a risk-aware culture across all levels of the organization.


Risk Identification &amp; Assessment:


	Lead periodic risk assessments across business units to identify strategic, operational, financial, compliance, and reputational risks.
	Maintain and update the corporate risk register, ensuring timely escalation of critical risks.


Monitoring &amp; Reporting:


	Establish key risk indicators (KRIs) and dashboards to monitor risk exposure and trends.
	Prepare and present risk reports to senior management and relevant governance committees.
	Ensure timely reporting of emerging risks and incidents


Governance &amp; Compliance:


	&nbsp;Support the Head of Governance &amp; Control in embedding the Three Lines Model, ensuring clear delineation of roles between risk owners, oversight functions, and assurance providers.
	Collaborate with Internal Audit, Compliance, and other control functions to ensure integrated risk oversight.


Risk Mitigation &amp; Advisory:


	Work with business units to develop and implement risk mitigation strategies and action plans.
	Provide expert advice on risk implications of strategic decisions, projects, and investments.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	&nbsp;Liaise with external regulators, auditors, and consultants on risk-related matters.
	&nbsp;Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders to facilitate effective risk management.


Training &amp; Awareness:


	&nbsp;Design and deliver risk management training programs to build capacity across the organization.
	Champion awareness initiatives to promote proactive risk ownership


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Risk Management, Finance, Business Administration, or related field; master&rsquo;s degree is an advantage.
	Minimum of 5&ndash;7 years of relevant experience in risk management, governance, or internal control, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
	Professional certifications such as CRMA, ERM, ISO 31000, CIA, ACA, ACCA or equivalent.
	Strong understanding of enterprise risk frameworks, regulatory compliance, and governance structures.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and analytical skills
	Strong leadership and stakeholder management
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Deep knowledge of risk assessment methodologies
	Integrity, objectivity, and sound judgment
	Ability to influence and drive change


Additional Information
Context and Environment:&nbsp;


	The Risk Manager will operate within a dynamic and evolving business environment, where proactive risk identification and mitigation are essential to sustaining operational resilience, regulatory compliance, and strategic growth. As part of the Governance &amp; Control Department, the Risk Manager will play a pivotal role in embedding a risk-aware culture across the organization and ensuring that risk management practices are integrated into decision-making at all levels.
	The organization is currently undergoing a transformation to strengthen its governance structure in alignment with the Three Lines Model, which clearly delineates responsibilities for risk ownership (first line), risk oversight (second line), and independent assurance (third line). The Risk Manager will lead the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Unit, serving as the second line of defense, and will work closely with business units, compliance, internal audit, and executive leadership to ensure a coordinated and effective approach to risk management.
	&nbsp;The role requires a high level of collaboration, analytical thinking, and strategic foresight, as the Risk Manager will be expected to:
	Navigate complex regulatory landscapes.
	Anticipate emerging risks (e.g., cybersecurity, ESG, operational disruptions).
	&nbsp;Support business continuity planning and crisis response.
	&nbsp;Provide risk insights that inform strategic initiatives and investment decisions.
	&nbsp;The Risk Manager will also be instrumental in developing risk frameworks, tools, and reporting mechanisms that enable the organization to monitor risk exposure in real time and respond with agility. The environment is fast paced, with a strong emphasis on innovation, accountability, and continuous.

Risk Manager Job at Eat 'N’ Go Limited




        
    

        
        Eat 'N’ Go Limited is a restaurant group on a mission to become the premier food operator in Africa. So far, our growing family consists of three international brands, Domino's Pizza, Cold Stone Creamery & Pinkberry.
Eat ‘N’ Go limited officially started operation in August 2012 with the premier store at 4, Saka Tinubu Victoria Island, Lagos. Today, Eat N' Go has about 100 stores (outlet) across Nigeria and still growing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Risk Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	To lead the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Unit and drive the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of a robust risk management framework across the organization.
	The Risk Manager will ensure that risks are proactively identified, assessed, monitored, and mitigated in alignment with the organization’s strategic objectives and in accordance with the Three Lines Model of governance.


Responsibilities
Strategic Risk Leadership:


	 Develop and implement the organization’s enterprise risk management framework, policies, and procedures.
	 Align risk management practices with corporate strategy and regulatory requirements.
	Promote a risk-aware culture across all levels of the organization.


Risk Identification & Assessment:


	Lead periodic risk assessments across business units to identify strategic, operational, financial, compliance, and reputational risks.
	Maintain and update the corporate risk register, ensuring timely escalation of critical risks.


Monitoring & Reporting:


	Establish key risk indicators (KRIs) and dashboards to monitor risk exposure and trends.
	Prepare and present risk reports to senior management and relevant governance committees.
	Ensure timely reporting of emerging risks and incidents


Governance & Compliance:


	 Support the Head of Governance & Control in embedding the Three Lines Model, ensuring clear delineation of roles between risk owners, oversight functions, and assurance providers.
	Collaborate with Internal Audit, Compliance, and other control functions to ensure integrated risk oversight.


Risk Mitigation & Advisory:


	Work with business units to develop and implement risk mitigation strategies and action plans.
	Provide expert advice on risk implications of strategic decisions, projects, and investments.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	 Liaise with external regulators, auditors, and consultants on risk-related matters.
	 Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders to facilitate effective risk management.


Training & Awareness:


	 Design and deliver risk management training programs to build capacity across the organization.
	Champion awareness initiatives to promote proactive risk ownership


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Risk Management, Finance, Business Administration, or related field; master’s degree is an advantage.
	Minimum of 5–7 years of relevant experience in risk management, governance, or internal control, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
	Professional certifications such as CRMA, ERM, ISO 31000, CIA, ACA, ACCA or equivalent.
	Strong understanding of enterprise risk frameworks, regulatory compliance, and governance structures.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and analytical skills
	Strong leadership and stakeholder management
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Deep knowledge of risk assessment methodologies
	Integrity, objectivity, and sound judgment
	Ability to influence and drive change


Additional Information
Context and Environment: 


	The Risk Manager will operate within a dynamic and evolving business environment, where proactive risk identification and mitigation are essential to sustaining operational resilience, regulatory compliance, and strategic growth. As part of the Governance & Control Department, the Risk Manager will play a pivotal role in embedding a risk-aware culture across the organization and ensuring that risk management practices are integrated into decision-making at all levels.
	The organization is currently undergoing a transformation to strengthen its governance structure in alignment with the Three Lines Model, which clearly delineates responsibilities for risk ownership (first line), risk oversight (second line), and independent assurance (third line). The Risk Manager will lead the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Unit, serving as the second line of defense, and will work closely with business units, compliance, internal audit, and executive leadership to ensure a coordinated and effective approach to risk management.
	 The role requires a high level of collaboration, analytical thinking, and strategic foresight, as the Risk Manager will be expected to:
	Navigate complex regulatory landscapes.
	Anticipate emerging risks (e.g., cybersecurity, ESG, operational disruptions).
	 Support business continuity planning and crisis response.
	 Provide risk insights that inform strategic initiatives and investment decisions.
	 The Risk Manager will also be instrumental in developing risk frameworks, tools, and reporting mechanisms that enable the organization to monitor risk exposure in real time and respond with agility. The environment is fast paced, with a strong emphasis on innovation, accountability, and continuous.

Confidential Secretary Job at Obafemi Awolowo University Teaching Hospitals Complex




        
    

        
        The Obafemi Awolowo University Teaching Hospitals Complex, ile-Ife, one of the foremost Teaching Hospitals in Nigeria, was founded on the Ife Philosophy as a guiding principle which focuses on an integrated healthcare delivery system approach with emphasis on comprehensive healthcare services comprising primary at the base, secondary and tertiary services at the hospital settings. The institution has six (6) healthcare hosital units with 780 -Bed complement and 55 Dental Chairs offering diverse and specialized services.
     

            
    



The vision of the institution is to become a leading centre of excellence in every Clinical Training and Support Services while its mission is to provide quality healthcare services, Manpower Development through Training and Research for the overall Benefit of the Patients and the Society.

Applications are hereby invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Confidential Secretary

Job Location: Ile-Ife, Osun

Qualifications


	Candidates must possess a minimum of an Ordinary National Diploma (OND) in Office Technology Management.


Salary Grade Level
CONHESS 05 Step 01 (N1,101,174.00 / Annum).

Conditions of Service:


	These are similar to those obtainable in the Federal Public Service and Federal Tertiary Health Institutions in Nigeria.


Note: All applications should be made in the institution's prescribed Employment Application Online.

	Ensure all designs are optimized for web and mobile platforms.
	Monitor trends in design, motion graphics, and web technologies to keep the company&rsquo;s digital presence innovative and competitive.

	Experience with web content management systems (WordPress or similar) and basic knowledge of HTML/CSS.
	Strong creative and artistic skills with a keen eye for detail, layout, and color.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong communication and collaboration skills.
